titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the photograph album Tunisia Travel on the Kairouan AD.MC.043
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Soliman and Jonathan Burr for Akkasah: Center for Photography at NYUAD

publicationstmt.publisher: Akkasah: Center for Photography (NYU Abu Dhabi)

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-05-21 18:30:51 +0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

repository.corpname: Akkasah: Center for Photography (NYU Abu Dhabi)

did.unittitle: A Trip to Tunisia on the Kairouan

physdesc.extent: 107 gelatin silver photographs contained within an album measuring 36 x 25 cm

did.abstract: A travel album of a trip to Tunisia on the ship Kairouan circa 1950s, containing 107 gelatin silver photographs. Numerous sites across Tunisia are visited, including: Tunis, Carthage, Sidi Bou Said, Nabeul, Hammamet, Monastie, Mahdia, Sousse,El Djem, Gabes, Sfax, Matmatas, Douiret, Djerba, Gafsa, Medenine and Kairouan.
did.physdesc: Excellent condition. No tears or foxing.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection processed as it was received.

did.unittitle: The front cover of the album 'A Trip to Tunisia on the Kairouan.'
A map of Tunisia.
The title page of the album 'A Trip to Tunisia on the Kairouan.' Beneath the title is a photograph of the ship Kairouan.
Group portraits of men and women on the deck of the Kairouan, with views of the ship setting sail from Marseille with the Palais du Pharo in the background.
Views of Tunisia taken from the ship labeled 'first contact (premier contact)' with a view of the Bay of Tunis.
From the top-left clockwise: a view of the Bab el Bahr, and two views of the Al-Zaytuna Mosque.

did.unittitle: From left to right: two street views of men and women walking in Tunis, and a postcard of the Youssef Dey Mosque/Al B'chamqiya.

origination.label: Creator

did.unittitle: Postcards of the souk in Tunis.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Editions de luxe " Estel" Lavelle & Cie, Paris

did.unittitle: Three views of the Alaoui Museum (now The National Bardo Museum), and a group portrait of tourists walking through Tunis.
Clippings from printed material of the ancient port and Roman ruins in Carthage.
From the top-left clockwise: An archaeological site undergoing excavation, remnants of Roman temples, a group of tourists, and two stelae in Carthage.
Top and right: clippings of women and girls. Bottom and Left: Women and girls in Sidi Bou Said.
Views and clippings of potters and pottery in Nabeul, Tunisia.
From the top left clockwise: a portrait of stonemasons, children working on looms, a crowd at a carpet souk, and a doorway and a postcard of people at a market in a kasbah/ribat.

controlaccess.geogname: Dar Chaabane El Fehri, Nabeul, Tunisia

did.unittitle: Left: a postcard of donkeys at a market. Right: a portrait of a man and a child riding donkeys.
From the top left clockwise: a fishing net for Tuna, a newspaper clipping of a bride, and a wedding procession in Hammamet, Tunisia.
Portraits of people on the coast and the Ribat of Monastir, Tunisia.
From the top left clockwise: a postcard of a kasbah/ribat, a portrait of a man leaning on a car, and a postcard of sardine fishing boats in Mahdia, Tunisia.
From the top left clockwise: a postcard of buildings in Sousse, buildings captioned "Moorish house", a postcard of and Mahdia and view of Kairouan.

From the left clockwise: a group of tourists on the beach, a group of boys, a portrait of a man and a woman on the roof of a STTAS (Soci√©t√© Tunisienne des Transports Automobiles du Sahel) bus and a man fixing a broken down vehicle in Sousse, Tunisia.

A page entitled 'The jobs of Tunisians (Les occupations des Tunisiens).' From the left clockwise: clippings of a woman begging, artisans weaving, a postcard of a group of people, and a group at a restaurant (Please note: This material has been digitized in its entirety and contains racist and culturally insensitive remarks).
An aerial view of the Amphitheatre of El Djem.
Interior and exterior views of the Amphitheatre of El Djem.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: CAP - Compagnie (Alsacienne) des Arts Photom√©caniques, Strasbourg & Paris

did.unittitle: Views of the oasis in Gabes, Tunisia.
From the top left clockwise: a postcard palm trees in a desert, a clipping of a group of camels at a watering hole, and a portrait of a woman and a child (linked 043_ref24).
Views of a body of water and palm trees.
Views of a body of water and palm trees.
Views of carriages and the road on the way to an oasis.
Views of men and animals operating water pumps/wells.
Left: a postcard of a street view of Tunisia. Right: a postcard of people at a stream.

Left: a newspaper clipping captioned "In Sfax, Mahdia and Monastir, there are sponge fishermen's cooperatives. The diving school in Bizerte has renewed the technique of this maritime craft.". Right: sponges on the coast.
Views of camels throughout Tunisia, including a view of the market at Tataouine.
Left: a postcard of two men praying in the desert. Right: a view of the desert.
Views of the Berber underground homes in Matmata.

Views of the Berber underground homes in Matmata. From the top left clockwise: the entrance to the dwelling, a family living in the dwellings, a courtyard, the master bedroom, and a woman weaving on a loom.
Views of ruins in Douiret, Tunisia.
From the top left clockwise: Three views of Marabout Tombs on the way to Douiret, Hergla, and Gabes.
Page captioned "nomads". Top left clockwise: a postcard of a caravan of camels, a group standing beside a camel, a postcard of women and children beside a tent.
Left: a postcard of a snake charmer surrounded by a crowd. Right: a postcard of people at a market.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: CAP - Compagnie (Alsacienne) des Arts Photom√©caniques, Strasbourg & Paris

did.unittitle: From the top left clockwise: a group portrait of tourists on a boat, a boy in front of a buildings, a woman at a well, and a mosque on the island of Djerba.
Two views of the El Ghriba synagogue and two views of a hotel that "serves as a hotel for pilgrims during major Jewish holidays" on Djerba Island.
From the top left clockwise: a woman and man holding hands, a group portrait at an oasis, two views of the Great Mosque of Gafsa, and Roman baths.
Views of the ghorfas of Medenine, Tunisia.
Views of mosque architecture, including the the Great Mosque of Kairouan/Mosque of Uqba in Kairouan, Tunisia.
Views of the Zaouia of Sidi Sahab (Barbier Mausoleum) in Kairouan, Tunisia.
Two group portraits of tourists preparing for departure from Tunisia, and a view of the Tunisian coast from a ship.
The inside back cover of the album 'A Trip to Tunisia on the Kairouan.'
The back cover of the album 'A Trip to Tunisia on the Kairouan.'
Left: a postcard of the oasis in Tozeur. Right: a clipping of a man next to a camel from a french missionary.
